preflight.conclusion: Authentication and basic setup working correctly

dashboard_deployment.subsequent_steps: All post-deployment steps skipped due to failure

mcp_services_repo.note: Despite cancellation, MCP Repo service is actually running and healthy
mcp_services_repo.anomaly: Service operational despite job cancellation - suggests existing deployment

mcp_services_business.secrets_status: Secrets set successfully before deployment failure

root_cause_analysis.primary_issue: Docker deployment failures across multiple services
evidence: Dashboard deployment failed at 'Deploy service (Dockerfile)' step
MCP Business deployment failed at same step immediately after secrets were set
MCP Repo deployment was cancelled but shows existing healthy deployment

likely_causes.evidence: Multiple services failing at identical Docker deployment step
Rapid failures suggest resource allocation issues
Preflight checks passed, indicating basic connectivity works

deployment_pattern_analysis.secrets_management: WORKING - Secrets successfully set before deployment failures
deployment_pattern_analysis.app_provisioning: WORKING - Apps exist and are accessible
deployment_pattern_analysis.docker_deployment: FAILING - Multiple services failing at Docker step
deployment_pattern_analysis.health_checking: BLOCKED - Cannot verify due to deployment failures

mcp_repo_anomaly.observation: MCP Repo service shows healthy status despite job cancellation
mcp_repo_anomaly.hypothesis: Service was deployed successfully in previous workflow run
mcp_repo_anomaly.implication: Docker deployment can work when conditions are right

immediate_remediation_required.action: Investigate Docker build logs for dashboard and MCP business services
Check Fly.io organization limits and resource quotas
Manual deployment attempt with verbose logging enabled
